headline: Bank of America, Citigroup Weigh New Credit Cards With 10% Rate
summary: Bank of America and Citigroup are exploring options they could offer up as an olive branch to satisfy President Donald Trump's demand to cap credit card interest rates at 10% for one year. Saul Martinez, Head of US Financials Research at HSBC says that the proposed 10% cap on credit card interest rates would be difficult to implement without new legislation and is unlikely to materially change bank profitability in the near term. He joined the discussion on "Bloomberg Markets" with Scarlet Fu.

headline: Sector Update: Financial Stocks Higher in Afternoon Trading
summary: Financial stocks were advancing in Thursday afternoon trading, with the NYSE Financial Index up 0.8%

headline: ?Bank of America CEO Brian Moynihan on What’s Next for the Economy
summary: Bank of America Chief Executive Brian Moynihan speaks with WSJ Leadership Institute's Alan Murray at Davos about why the bank has increased its projected U.S. GDP growth rate this year to 2.8%. Also, the 17-time Davos veteran shares his tips for getting the most out of the conference.

headline: Bank of America, Citi Weighing New Credit Cards With 10% Rate
summary: Bank of America and Citigroup are exploring options they could offer up as an olive branch to satisfy President Donald Trump's demand to cap credit card interest rates at 10% for one year. Katherine Doherty reports on Bloomberg Television.

headline: Bank of America’s Moynihan Sees Faster-Than-Expected U.S. GDP Growth in 2026. Here’s What’s Driving It.
summary: Bank of America CEO Brian Moynihan speaks with WSJ Leadership Institute President Alan Murray in Davos and says the bank has increased its U.S. GDP growth rate for 2026 to 2.8%—outpacing consensus forecasts by economists. Moynihan outlines why he’s bullish on the U.S. economy and what’s driving the higher growth outlook.

headline: Bank of America, Citigroup consider new credit cards with 10% rate, Bloomberg News reports

headline: Bank of America CEO Moynihan Says Credit Card Cap May Not Work as Expected
summary: Bank of America CEO Brian Moynihan discusses the company's work with the White House to solve affordability issues for Americans. He says President Donald Trump's proposed 10% cap on credit card interest rates may have "an equal but opposite reaction." He speaks on "Bloomberg Surveillance" from the World Economic Forum in Davos.
